intro: Spermacoce hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy false nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by spherical, yellowish berries. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous tiny seeds. Spermacoce hirsuta is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
